thread.title: Troy Tulowitzki likely to return Saturday
thread.title_full: Troy Tulowitzki likely to return Saturday

author: Bob Hille
title: Troy Tulowitzki likely to return Saturday
text:
Troy Tulowitzki likely to return Saturday Sporting News 3 hrs ago Bob Hille © Tom Szczerbowski/Getty Images Troy Tulowitzki of the Toronto Blue Jays reacts after hitting a solo home run during a game against the Minnesota Twins on Aug. 4, 2015, in Toronto. The Blue Jays won 3-1. Blue Jays shortstop Troy Tulowitzki, sidelined since Sept. 12 with a cracked left shoulder blade, is expected to return to action Saturday, MLB.com reported .
AdChoices If things go as planned Friday in a simulated game against David Price, then Tulowitzki would get in two live games in an effort to knock off the rust before the postseason.
MORE: Get to know the Blue Jays | David Price's Cy Young-worthy games
The Jays open AL Division Series action next Thursday against an opponent still to be determined.
"A sim game on Friday, and then I think the thought was to maybe play Saturday, Sunday — that's just what we talked about," Jays general manager Alex Anthopoulos said. "He may play against the Rays, we haven't committed to anything."
Tulowitzki took more live batting practice Thursday in Baltimore and after Friday's simulated game at Tropicana Field, he could return Saturday against the Rays.
Injured in a collision with outfielder Kevin Pillar at Yankee Stadium, Tulowitzki is batting .232/.314/.368 with five home runs and 17 RBIs since being acquired from the Rockies at the trade deadline.
